daily_analyst_summary: Today’s threat landscape highlights a surge in remote code execution vulnerabilities primarily targeting web application interfaces and file upload functionalities across multiple platforms, including Xwiki, Fortinet Fortiweb, and Gladinet products. Noteworthy exploitation trends focus on improper input validation and web management interface flaws, while critical vulnerabilities in widely used software such as Google Chrome and Samsung Android emphasize the ongoing risks in client-side and mobile environments. Organizations should prioritize patching these high-impact CVEs to mitigate risks of unauthorized access and system compromise.
daily_ciso_summary: The current vulnerability landscape presents significant business risks due to multiple critical remote code execution and unauthorized access flaws across widely used platforms such as Xwiki, Fortinet Fortiweb, Oracle Identity Manager, and Google Chrome, exposing organizations to potential data breaches and operational disruptions. These vulnerabilities directly increase financial risk by threatening the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive data, potentially leading to regulatory fines, loss of customer trust, and costly incident response efforts. To mitigate these risks, the focus should be on rapid patch management, strengthening input validation controls, and enhancing monitoring of web-facing applications and identity management systems to prevent exploitation.

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-24893 affects Xwiki by allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted input that is improperly handled in the file upload functionality.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-24893 poses an immediate risk to Xwiki users, as it can potentially expose sensitive data through an unpatched vulnerability, necessitating urgent mitigation to prevent data breaches and protect business continuity.
cves.description: CVE-2025-24893 affects Xwiki by allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted input that is improperly handled in the file upload functionality.

news_article.title: RondoDox Exploits Unpatched XWiki Servers to Pull More Devices Into Its Botnet

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-64446 affects the Fortinet Fortiweb web application firewall, allowing a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via crafted requests due to improper validation of input parameters.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-64446 exposes Fortinet FortiWeb to critical vulnerabilities that could lead to substantial business disruptions and data breaches, necessitating immediate mitigation to protect sensitive information and maintain operational integrity.
cves.description: CVE-2025-64446 affects the Fortinet Fortiweb web application firewall, allowing a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via crafted requests due to improper validation of input parameters.

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-9242 affects WatchGuard Fireware, allowing remote attackers to exploit a vulnerability in the web management interface to execute arbitrary code via crafted HTTP requests.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-9242 poses a critical risk to our network security by allowing potential unauthorized access to sensitive data through vulnerabilities in Watchguard Fireware, necessitating immediate mitigation efforts to prevent significant business disruption and data breaches.
cves.description: CVE-2025-9242 affects WatchGuard Fireware, allowing remote attackers to exploit a vulnerability in the web management interface to execute arbitrary code via crafted HTTP requests.

news_article.title: CISA Flags Critical WatchGuard Fireware Flaw Exposing 54,000 Fireboxes to No-Login Attacks

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-61757 is a vulnerability in Oracle Identity Manager that allows an unauthenticated attacker to exploit a flaw in the web interface, potentially leading to unauthorized access and manipulation of user accounts.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-61757 presents a critical vulnerability in Oracle Identity Manager that could lead to unauthorized access and significant data breaches, posing an immediate threat to our data security and necessitating prompt remediation to protect our business assets.
cves.description: CVE-2025-61757 is a vulnerability in Oracle Identity Manager that allows an unauthenticated attacker to exploit a flaw in the web interface, potentially leading to unauthorized access and manipulation of user accounts.

news_article.title: CISA orders feds to patch Oracle Identity Manager zero-day after signs of abuse

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-12480 affects Gladinet Triofox, allowing attackers to exploit improper input validation in the file upload feature to execute arbitrary code on the server.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-12480 exposes Gladinet Triofox users to significant data breaches and compliance violations, necessitating immediate mitigation actions to protect sensitive information and uphold business integrity.
cves.description: CVE-2025-12480 affects Gladinet Triofox, allowing attackers to exploit improper input validation in the file upload feature to execute arbitrary code on the server.

news_article.title: Hackers Exploiting Triofox Flaw to Install Remote Access Tools via Antivirus Feature

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-48703 is a vulnerability in Control-webpanel Webpanel that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted input, exploiting insufficient input validation in user-uploaded files.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-48703 exposes Control-webpanel Webpanel to potential unauthorized access and data breaches, posing an urgent risk to our business operations and customer trust that must be mitigated immediately.
cves.description: CVE-2025-48703 is a vulnerability in Control-webpanel Webpanel that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted input, exploiting insufficient input validation in user-uploaded files.

news_article.title: Critical Control Web Panel vulnerability is actively exploited (CVE-2025-48703)

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-11371 affects Gladinet Centrestack by allowing an attacker to exploit a directory traversal vulnerability, enabling unauthorized access to sensitive files on the server.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-11371 poses an urgent risk to Gladinet Centrestack, potentially leading to unauthorized data access that could jeopardize sensitive business information and integrity, necessitating immediate mitigation efforts.
cves.description: CVE-2025-11371 affects Gladinet Centrestack by allowing an attacker to exploit a directory traversal vulnerability, enabling unauthorized access to sensitive files on the server.

news_article.title: Hackers Exploiting Triofox Flaw to Install Remote Access Tools via Antivirus Feature

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-58034 is a vulnerability in Fortinet Fortiweb that allows attackers to exploit improperly validated input, leading to potential remote code execution on the affected component.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-58034 exposes Fortinet Fortiweb to critical vulnerabilities that could lead to significant business disruptions and data breaches, requiring immediate remediation to mitigate potential severe financial and reputational damage.
cves.description: CVE-2025-58034 is a vulnerability in Fortinet Fortiweb that allows attackers to exploit improperly validated input, leading to potential remote code execution on the affected component.

news_article.title: Fortinet Warns of New FortiWeb CVE-2025-58034 Vulnerability Exploited in the Wild

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-13223 is a vulnerability in Google Chrome that enables an attacker to exploit a use-after-free condition in the browser’s rendering engine, potentially allowing arbitrary code execution.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-13223 is a critical vulnerability in Google Chrome that exposes organizations to potential data breaches and significant reputational damage, necessitating urgent patching to mitigate risks.
cves.description: CVE-2025-13223 is a vulnerability in Google Chrome that enables an attacker to exploit a use-after-free condition in the browser’s rendering engine, potentially allowing arbitrary code execution.

news_article.title: Google patches yet another exploited Chrome zero-day (CVE-2025-13223)

cves.summary_analyst: CVE-2025-21042 is a vulnerability in Samsung Android that allows attackers to exploit a flaw in the media processing component, enabling remote code execution through specially crafted media files.
cves.summary_ciso: CVE-2025-21042 poses a significant risk to Samsung Android devices, potentially exposing sensitive user data and enabling unauthorized access, which requires immediate remediation to prevent critical business impacts and protect customer trust.
cves.description: CVE-2025-21042 is a vulnerability in Samsung Android that allows attackers to exploit a flaw in the media processing component, enabling remote code execution through specially crafted media files.

news_article.title: Previously unknown Landfall spyware used in 0-day attacks on Samsung phones
